intro: Wibelia denticulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wibelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, dainty flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and has finely toothed leaves that give it its scientific name. It is a perennial herb that produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals. Wibelia denticulata is often found in association with other wildflowers in its native habitat.
